result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Request to adjourn Preliminary hearing
**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 08-15-2022. "There are alleged victims in both actions. Marsy's Law does not allow for such an adjournment. The date may, however, be used as a status hearing for the purpose of scheduling future dates. Counsel may appear for the 8/17/22 hearing by Zoom."
Attorney Paul Marchan

Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

1:35 PM Defendant Jon R Strnad in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to seek counsel. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court notes defendant has an initial appearance set for August 17, 2022 at 1:00 pm for case 22CM1332 and will tag this case along for status of counsel.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant in regards to income and notes it is unlikely he would qualify for Court appointed counsel.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

defendant will be out of town and would like to reschedule. Sent to CC herring for review. As of 7/19: court responded: Due to Victim notification and Marsy's law the court will not reschedule but will allow for Defendant's appearance via Zoom
